subject: systemcommands: Modify PCIe bifurcation command internals

Openbmc does not intend the namespace scopes. so need to align all the lines within the namespace has to be fixed.
We can make another patchset to address the code syntax, so this patchset is focused on PCIe bifurcation changes.

This does not need to be vector. This is always going to be 2 bytes. 
1st byte for presence and 2nd byte for bifurcation. 
Change it to ipmi::RspType<uint8_t, uint8_t>

The whole logic can be rewritten to 
ifstream file open
use std::getline 
use sscanf and extract the bifurcation and presence info
Rewrite these lines to limit to 100 chars
No need for this prefix since the repo is foxconn-ipmi-oem
Name this to bifurcation and presence so it is clear in what is being read and sent as response to this command
is this validated with the file's output format?

follow same style. 

ipmi::RspType<uint8_t, uint8_t, uint8_t, uint8_t> ipmiAppGetSystemIfCapabilities(uint8_t iface)
Have you thought about using constexpr instead #define ..?
constexpr is typed and hence safer in certain scenarios. Since we are dealing with a string I don't see how one would necessarily be better than the other.
the common OpenBMC .clangformat doesn't indent for a namespace (should be fixed in a separate formatting patch though)
The presence variable isn't used before the sscanf where it's value is updated. It is only being accessed after that and any initialisation we do will be overwritten.
